lexUnit.name: nod.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: lower and raise one's head slightly and briefly to convey a message

sentence.text: I indicated a chair and she nodded that it was OK for me to sit down .
His eyes flared over Maggie as he nodded her to a seat .
Baldwin nodded assent to both propositions .
The blond man had nodded a greeting to her , and Carol had been aware of his appraising gaze .
From the altar the priest nodded a smile of recognition to the best man .
One of them nodded a greeting to Susan .
Robert , glancing at her for confirmation , saw her frown , but ignored it and nodded his thanks to the keeper .
She saw Sarah nod agreement out of the corner of her eye .
Rebecque nodded acceptance of the offer .
Rostov saw several of the older men nodding agreement .
Though clearly unhappy at the responsibility , the vaquero nodded his understanding .
As we entered the bloated face nodded us a silent greeting .
He nodded at Bacci for a translation .
Blanche winked at Dexter and nodded for him to follow her outside with his coat .
